info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Possible waterspout nearing shore for portions of northern Porter County through 445 PM CDT... At 349 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong shower capable of producing a waterspout over Lake Michigan about 3 miles northeast of Ogden Dunes, or 7 miles north of Chesterton, moving south at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph, as well as possible lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chesterton, Porter, Burns Harbor, Town of Pines, Beverly Shores and Dune Acres. This includes... Indiana Dunes State Park. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
